metadata.title: CVE-2023-2006 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A race condition was found in the Linux kernel's RxRPC network protocol,within the processing of RxRPC bundles. This issue results from the lack ofproper locking when performing operations on an object. This may allow anattacker to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the contextof the kernel.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2006` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
